analyzed: mi mthong bar 'gyur /

analyzed: rgyal po bcun mo'i 'khor dang bcas pa dbang du 'gyur ro //

analyzed: mi smra bar grong khyer du song na /

analyzed: mig g-yas pa la bskus na /

analyzed: rigs ngan thams cad dbang du 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas bye ba stong phrag drug cu'i drung du dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed par 'gyur /

original: thams cad kyis bzung ba byas par 'gyur /
analyzed: thams cad kyis bzung ba byas par 'gyur /
translated: All of them will accept him.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa stong mnyes par byas par 'gyur /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa stong mnyes par byas par 'gyur /
translated: He will please a thousand tathāgatas.

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa stong phrag drug cu rtsa bzhi mngon du mthong ba thob par 'gyur /
translated: He will attain the direct perception of six hundred forty thousand tathāgatas.🔽He will accomplish all worldly aims.

analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i don thams cad 'grub par @357b 'gyur; sden gyi sgrib pas mnar med pa'i gnas su 'gro ba yongs su dag par 'gyur /

analyzed: nam yang ngan song du 'gro bar mi 'gyur /
translated: He will never go to the lower realms.

translated: All the gods will grant him boons and will always protect, guard, and conceal him.

original: phyag g-yon pa mnan te lan stong rtsa brgyad bzlas brjod byas na /
analyzed: phyag g-yon pa mnan te lan stong rtsa brgyad bzlas brjod byas na /
translated: If he presses his left hand down and recites the mantra one thousand and eight times,

analyzed: bzlas pa tsam gyi mod la lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / srin po la sogs pa bkug par 'gyur zhing thams cad dbang du 'gyur te gnas so //

analyzed: gang gi tshe dgos pa byung ba de'i tshe don yod par grub pa'i rig sngags kyi rgyal po lan bdun bzlas pa byas na /

translated: He should avoid bad food, bad drink, bad clothes, and bad smells. He should avoid bad beings, bad supports, bad tricksters, bad killers, and bad people.

analyzed: gnas ngan pa dang / gnas brtan ngan pa dang / sgom nyes dang / bza' nyes dang / grib ma ngan pa yongs su spang bar bya /

original: bkra shis tshang bar bya zhing /

translated: it will be as if the great Dharma bheri is being beaten.

original: gang dag sgra thos pa tsam gyis sems can thams cad kyi mtshams med pa lnga'i sdig pa rab tu zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang dag sgra thos pa tsam gyis sems can thams cad kyi mtshams med pa lnga'i sdig pa rab tu zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By merely hearing the sound, the evil of the five acts of immediate retribution of all sentient beings will be pacified.

original: tha na dud 'gro'i skye gnas su gtogs pa'i ri dvags dang / bya gang yin pa de dag thams cad kyang yongs su grol bar 'gyur ro //🔽'phags pa la skur pa 'debs pa dang / dam pa'i chos spong pa dang / mnar med pa la gzhol zhing gnas @377a *//
analyzed: tha na dud 'gro'i skye gnas su gtogs pa'i ri dvags dang / bya gang yin pa de dag thams cad kyang yongs su grol bar 'gyur ro // 'phags pa la skur pa 'debs pa dang / dam pa'i chos spong pa dang / mnar med pa la gzhol zhing gnas @377a *//
translated: Even those who are born as animals, such as deer and birds, will all be liberated.

original: pa dag las yongs su grol bar 'gyur /
analyzed: pa dag las yongs su grol bar 'gyur /
translated: They will be liberated from slandering the noble ones, from abandoning the sublime Dharma, and from being destined for and dwelling in the Avīci Hell.

original: dmyal ba chen po bcu drug las yongs su grol bar 'gyur /
analyzed: dmyal ba chen po bcu drug las yongs su grol bar 'gyur /
translated: They will be liberated from the sixteen great hells.

original: 'jigs pa chen po brgyad las yongs su grol bar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'jigs pa chen po brgyad las yongs su grol bar 'gyur /
translated: They will be liberated from the eight great fears.

original: de la dug gi 'jigs pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de la dug gi 'jigs pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur /
translated: They will not have any fear of poison.

original: me'i 'jigs pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: me'i 'jigs pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur /
translated: They will not have any fear of fire.

original: mtshon gyi 'jigs pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: mtshon gyi 'jigs pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur /
translated: They will not have any fear of weapons.

original: dus ma yin par 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: dus ma yin par 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur /
translated: They will not have any fear of untimely death.

original: rims thams cad kyi 'jigs pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: rims thams cad kyi 'jigs pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur /
translated: They will not have any fear of any epidemics.

original: 'di dung la bskus te bus na /
analyzed: 'di dung la bskus te bus na /
translated: If one anoints a conch with this and blows it,

original: chos kyi dung chen po bus par 'gyur /
analyzed: chos kyi dung chen po bus par 'gyur /
translated: it will be like blowing the great Dharma conch.

original: tha na dung gi sgra thos pa'i bar de dag thams cad kyang slar ldog par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: tha na dung gi sgra thos pa'i bar de dag thams cad kyang slar ldog par mi 'gyur /
translated: even the sound of the conch will cease.

original: skyes pa dang / bud med dang / khye'u dang / bu mo dag kyang skye ba dang / rga ba dang / nad dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa'i sdug bsngal las yongs su grol bar 'gyur /
analyzed: skyes pa dang / bud med dang / khye'u dang / bu mo dag kyang skye ba dang / rga ba dang / nad dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa'i sdug bsngal las yongs su grol bar 'gyur /
translated: Men, women, boys, and girls will be completely free from the suffering of birth, old age, sickness, death, sorrow, and lamentation.

original: 'di ni / skye ba phyi ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni / skye ba phyi ma yin te /
translated: This is the next life.

original: shi nas thams cad ris mthun par bde ba can gyi 'jig rten gyi khams su padma las brdzus te skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shi nas thams cad ris mthun par bde ba can gyi 'jig rten gyi khams su padma las brdzus te skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: After death, they will all be reborn miraculously in the Tuṣita realm, in accordance with their type, and will be born from a lotus.

original: lus skyes bu chen po'i mtshan dang / dpe byad kyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: lus skyes bu chen po'i mtshan dang / dpe byad kyis brgyan pa /
translated: Their bodies will be adorned with the major and minor marks of a great being.

original: rgyan thams cad kyis klubs pa; padma las skyil mo krung bcas te skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyan thams cad kyis klubs pa; padma las skyil mo krung bcas te skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be draped with all types of ornaments and will be born sitting cross-legged on a lotus.

original: byang chub kyi snying po la thug gi bar du 'od dpag med las mngon sum du chos kyi gtam thos par 'gyur @377b ro; ;zla ba yar gyi ngo la cod pan dkar po bcings te nor bu chen po 'di rgyal mtshan gyi rtse mo la btags na /
analyzed: byang chub kyi snying po la thug gi bar du 'od dpag med las mngon sum du chos kyi gtam thos par 'gyur @377b ro; ;zla ba yar gyi ngo la cod pan dkar po bcings te nor bu chen po 'di rgyal mtshan gyi rtse mo la btags na /
translated: If one ties a white turban on the head of a waxing moon and attaches this great jewel to the top of a victory banner,

original: bsgrengs pa tsam gyi mod la chos kyi rgyal mtshan bsgrengs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsgrengs pa tsam gyi mod la chos kyi rgyal mtshan bsgrengs par 'gyur ro //
translated: the moment it is raised, the banner of Dharma will be raised.

original: 'di rgyal mtshan gyi rtse mo la btags pa mthong ba tsam gyis de bzhin gshegs pa byang chub kyi snying por chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / bdud 'dul ba'i rgyal mtshan bsgreng bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di rgyal mtshan gyi rtse mo la btags pa mthong ba tsam gyis de bzhin gshegs pa byang chub kyi snying por chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / bdud 'dul ba'i rgyal mtshan bsgreng bar rig par bya'o //
translated: By merely seeing this attached to the top of a victory banner, one should know that the Thus-Gone One is turning the wheel of Dharma at the seat of awakening and raising the banner of taming Māra.

original: 'di bsgrengs pa tsam gyis 'thab pa dang / rtsod pa dang / khrag khrug thams cad zhi bar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di bsgrengs pa tsam gyis 'thab pa dang / rtsod pa dang / khrag khrug thams cad zhi bar 'gyur /
translated: By merely raising this, all quarrels, disputes, and conflicts will be pacified.

original: gnod pa thams cad dang / mi ngas dang / mu ge'i dgon pa rab tu zhi bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gnod pa thams cad dang / mi ngas dang / mu ge'i dgon pa rab tu zhi bar 'gyur /
translated: All harm, violence, and famine will be completely pacified.

original: chom po dang / g-yon can dang / rkun ma dang / phyir rgol ba dang / mi mdza' ba 'jig par 'gyur /
analyzed: chom po dang / g-yon can dang / rkun ma dang / phyir rgol ba dang / mi mdza' ba 'jig par 'gyur /
translated: crooked people, robbers, enemies, and those who are unaccommodating will be destroyed.

original: rang gi dpung dang / gzhan gyi dpung dang / sdang ba'i sems can rab tu zhi bar 'gyur /
analyzed: rang gi dpung dang / gzhan gyi dpung dang / sdang ba'i sems can rab tu zhi bar 'gyur /
translated: One’s own army, the army of others, and hostile beings will be pacified.

original: dug mi bzad pa dang / gcan gzan gtum po dang / bya dang / sbrang bu dang / sha sbrang dang / byi ba dang / sdig sbrul dang / 'bras dang / lu'u ta dang / dug dang / shu ba dang / lhog pa dang /
analyzed: dug mi bzad pa dang / gcan gzan gtum po dang / bya dang / sbrang bu dang / sha sbrang dang / byi ba dang / sdig sbrul dang / 'bras dang / lu'u ta dang / dug dang / shu ba dang / lhog pa dang /
translated: Venomous poisons, fierce beasts, birds, mosquitoes, flies, rats, snakes, rice, millet, poison, pustules, and tumors

original: mtshan bar rdol ba dang / ske bgegs pa thams cad 'jigs par 'gyur /
analyzed: mtshan bar rdol ba dang / ske bgegs pa thams cad 'jigs par 'gyur /
translated: and all the diseases of the anus and the throat will be destroyed.

original: sdang ba'i klu dang / ser ba dang / grang pa dang / rlung gis mi tshugs shing nad thams cad rab tu zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdang ba'i klu dang / ser ba dang / grang pa dang / rlung gis mi tshugs shing nad thams cad rab tu zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One will not be harmed by hostile nāgas, hail, cold, or wind, and all diseases will be pacified.

original: bde ba dang / dga' ba dang / lo legs pa dang / skye bo mang po dang / mi mang pos yongs su gang @378a *//
analyzed: bde ba dang / dga' ba dang / lo legs pa dang / skye bo mang po dang / mi mang pos yongs su gang @378a *//
translated: One will be happy, joyful, prosperous, and will be filled with many people and many humans.

original: zhing 'byor par 'gyur /
analyzed: zhing 'byor par 'gyur /
translated: One will be wealthy.

original: chos 'dod cing chos kyi kun dga' la dga' ba dang / mgu bar 'gyur /
analyzed: chos 'dod cing chos kyi kun dga' la dga' ba dang / mgu bar 'gyur /
translated: They will delight in the Dharma and take pleasure in the joy of the Dharma.

original: me tog dang / 'bras bu dang / lo tog dang / zas dang / skom ro zhim pa dang / shin tu 'jam pa phun sum tshogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: me tog dang / 'bras bu dang / lo tog dang / zas dang / skom ro zhim pa dang / shin tu 'jam pa phun sum tshogs par 'gyur /
translated: They will have abundant and excellent flowers, fruits, crops, food, drink, and delicious flavors.

original: thams cad du lha'i reg pa dang bcas pa'i bza' ba dang btung ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro //🔽sdang ba'i gnod sbyin dang / srin po dang / 'byung po dang / sha za dang / phra men ma dang / yi dvags dang / brjed byed dang / srul po dang / lus srul po dang / skem byed dang / grib ma dang / bza' nyes dang /
analyzed: thams cad du lha'i reg pa dang bcas pa'i bza' ba dang btung ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro // sdang ba'i gnod sbyin dang / srin po dang / 'byung po dang / sha za dang / phra men ma dang / yi dvags dang / brjed byed dang / srul po dang / lus srul po dang / skem byed dang / grib ma dang / bza' nyes dang /
translated: Everywhere, divine touch will be present in their food and drink.

original: 'gom nyes dang / blta nyes dang / grib ma ngan pa zhi bar 'gyur zhing mi tshugs par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'gom nyes dang / blta nyes dang / grib ma ngan pa zhi bar 'gyur zhing mi tshugs par 'gyur /
translated: The harmful yakṣas, rākṣasas, bhūtas, piśācas, kaṭapūtanas, pretas, āpasmāras, skandapasmāras, ojohāras, chāyās, and āsphoṭas will be pacified and will not be able to harm them.

original: sems can de dag thams cad phan tshun byams pa'i sems su 'gyur /
analyzed: sems can de dag thams cad phan tshun byams pa'i sems su 'gyur /
translated: All those beings will have loving thoughts toward each other.

original: mchog tu yid bde ba'i gnas pas gnas pas gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mchog tu yid bde ba'i gnas pas gnas pas gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will abide in a state of supreme mental well-being.

original: yon tan dang phan yon chen po de dag ni /
analyzed: yon tan dang phan yon chen po de dag ni /
translated: These great qualities and benefits

original: nor bu'i rgyal po chen po'i byin gyis brlabs pa yin no //
analyzed: nor bu'i rgyal po chen po'i byin gyis brlabs pa yin no //
translated: are the blessings of the great king of jewels.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan snga na bzhin 'dzum zhing mig mi 'dzum pas bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan snga na bzhin 'dzum zhing mig mi 'dzum pas bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Ārya Avalokiteśvara, with a smiling face in the presence of the Blessed One, with eyes wide open, said this to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: grub pa'i rdzas kyi mchog nor bu gdags pa /
analyzed: grub pa'i rdzas kyi mchog nor bu gdags pa /
translated: the supreme accomplishment substance, the jewel designation,

original: de bzhin @378b gshegs pa thams cad kyi byin gyis brlabs shing lung bstan pa /
analyzed: de bzhin @378b gshegs pa thams cad kyi byin gyis brlabs shing lung bstan pa /
translated: blessed and prophesied by all the tathāgatas,

original: bdag gi snying po yid bzhin gyi nor bu chen po sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba'i phyir zhugs pa rjes su bsgrag par bgyi'o //
analyzed: bdag gi snying po yid bzhin gyi nor bu chen po sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba'i phyir zhugs pa rjes su bsgrag par bgyi'o //
translated: I will proclaim my essence, the great wish-fulfilling jewel, which is engaged for the benefit and happiness of all sentient beings.

original: gser dang / na la da dang / gi wang dang / ba bla dang / ldong ros dang / padma dang / autpa la dang / gur gum dang / n'a ga pus pa dang / tva tsa dang / ta ra ga dang / tsandan rnam gnyis dang /
analyzed: gser dang / na la da dang / gi wang dang / ba bla dang / ldong ros dang / padma dang / autpa la dang / gur gum dang / n'a ga pus pa dang / tva tsa dang / ta ra ga dang / tsandan rnam gnyis dang /
translated: the two kinds of sandalwood,🔽priyaka,🔽kalaka,🔽ruta,🔽shuti,🔽priyangu,🔽harinuka,🔽sugmel,🔽lotha,🔽jatapatrika,🔽sumana,

original: sprig ka dang / k'a la ka dang / ru rta dang / shu ti dang / pri yang ku dang / ha re nu ke dang / sug smel dang / lo dha dang / dz'a ta pa tri ka su ma na dang / sa ma ka dang /
analyzed: sprig ka dang / k'a la ka dang / ru rta dang / shu ti dang / pri yang ku dang / ha re nu ke dang / sug smel dang / lo dha dang / dz'a ta pa tri ka su ma na dang / sa ma ka dang /
translated: samaka,

original: sra rtsi phog dang / shing aarga'i 'o ma rnams bsags te cha mnyam par byas la gser nyis 'gyur du byas te rgyu skar bzang po dang / tshes grangs shis shing dge ba la khrus legs par byas te gos gtsang ma bgos nas nyin zhag gcig byams pa'i sems la mnyam par bzhag ste phye ma zhib mor byas te don yod pa'i zhags pa'i rgyal po'i snying po'i gzungs stong rtsa brgyad bzlas /
analyzed: sra rtsi phog dang / shing aarga'i 'o ma rnams bsags te cha mnyam par byas la gser nyis 'gyur du byas te rgyu skar bzang po dang / tshes grangs shis shing dge ba la khrus legs par byas te gos gtsang ma bgos nas nyin zhag gcig byams pa'i sems la mnyam par bzhag ste phye ma zhib mor byas te don yod pa'i zhags pa'i rgyal po'i snying po'i gzungs stong rtsa brgyad bzlas /
translated: Having collected the lac, the ghee, and the milk of the Arjuna tree, make them equal parts, and double the gold. On an auspicious day of the bright half of the month, having bathed well, dressed in clean clothes, and for one day and night remained in a state of loving kindness, make the powder very fine. Recite the essence mantra of Amoghapāśa one hundred and eight times.

original: khro bo'i rgyal po brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas te gtor la dri chab bzang pos sbangs te sbyar la gser dang bsres la ga pur dang / gla rtsi'i bdug pas bdugs te nor bu zho gnyis pa'i tshad du byas nas phug la ras skud kyis btags te gser gyis g-yogs la /
analyzed: khro bo'i rgyal po brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas te gtor la dri chab bzang pos sbangs te sbyar la gser dang bsres la ga pur dang / gla rtsi'i bdug pas bdugs te nor bu zho gnyis pa'i tshad du byas nas phug la ras skud kyis btags te gser gyis g-yogs la /
translated: Recite the king of wrathful mantras one hundred and eight times, and scatter it. Soak it with good perfume, mix it, and add gold. Fumigate it with camphor and musk. Make it into a gem the size of two-thirds of a barley grain, wrap it in cotton thread, and cover it with gold.

original: yang don yod pa'i zhags pa'i snying po stong rtsa brgyad bzlas /
analyzed: yang don yod pa'i zhags pa'i snying po stong rtsa brgyad bzlas /
translated: Again, recite the essence mantra of Amoghapāśa one hundred and eight times.

original: @379a *// khro bo'i rgyal po brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas te 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi spyan sngar mi smra bar bsgrubs par byas la de nyid kyi zhabs drung du grib ma la bskam par bya ste /
analyzed: @379a *// khro bo'i rgyal po brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas te 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi spyan sngar mi smra bar bsgrubs par byas la de nyid kyi zhabs drung du grib ma la bskam par bya ste /
translated: Drying it in the shade right there at his feet,

original: phyed dam bzhi cha gser gyis g-yogs par bya zhing phyed g-yogs par mi bya'o //
analyzed: phyed dam bzhi cha gser gyis g-yogs par bya zhing phyed g-yogs par mi bya'o //
translated: one should cover half or a quarter with gold, not covering the other half.

original: gang la gser gyis g-yogs pa 'di ni /
analyzed: gang la gser gyis g-yogs pa 'di ni /
translated: That which is covered with gold

original: gang la don yod pa'i zhags pa yid bzhin gyi nor bu chen po dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: gang la don yod pa'i zhags pa yid bzhin gyi nor bu chen po dang 'dra ste /
translated: is like the great wish-fulfilling gem of Amoghapaśa.

original: sangs rgyas kyi byang chub dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa las chen po sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi byang chub dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa las chen po sgrub par byed do //
translated: It accomplishes the great enlightenment of the Buddha, worldly and transcendent,

original: gser gyis ma g-yogs pas ni /
analyzed: gser gyis ma g-yogs pas ni /
translated: while that which is not covered with gold

original: 'jig rten pa'i dgos pa thams cad sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i dgos pa thams cad sgrub par byed do //
translated: accomplishes all worldly needs.

original: nad thams cad dang / gdon thams cad dang / lu'u ta dang / 'bras dang / 'go ba'i nad dang / shu ba dang / lhog pa dang / mtshan bar rdol ba dang / phol mig dang / sha bkra dang / mig nad dang / klad nad dang /
analyzed: nad thams cad dang / gdon thams cad dang / lu'u ta dang / 'bras dang / 'go ba'i nad dang / shu ba dang / lhog pa dang / mtshan bar rdol ba dang / phol mig dang / sha bkra dang / mig nad dang / klad nad dang /
translated: All illnesses, all spirits, leprosy, smallpox, contagious diseases, boils, epilepsy, anal fistula, tumors, vitiligo, eye diseases, brain diseases,

original: gzhogs phyed na ba dang / mgul pa 'gags pa dang / kha nad dang / sna nad dang / rna ba'i nad dang / so nad dang / rkan na ba dang / lce na ba dang / mchu na pa dang / snying na pa dang /
analyzed: gzhogs phyed na ba dang / mgul pa 'gags pa dang / kha nad dang / sna nad dang / rna ba'i nad dang / so nad dang / rkan na ba dang / lce na ba dang / mchu na pa dang / snying na pa dang /
translated: paralysis, throat blockage, mouth diseases, nose diseases, ear diseases, tooth diseases, palate diseases, tongue diseases, lip diseases, heart diseases,

original: rtsibs logs na ba dang / lto ba na ba dang / mchin pa na ba dang / rgyab na ba dang / gcin snyi ba dang / zug gzer dang / 'khru ba dang / pho ba'i nad dang / gzhang 'brum thams cad rab tu zhi bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: rtsibs logs na ba dang / lto ba na ba dang / mchin pa na ba dang / rgyab na ba dang / gcin snyi ba dang / zug gzer dang / 'khru ba dang / pho ba'i nad dang / gzhang 'brum thams cad rab tu zhi bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: side pains, stomach pains, liver pains, back pains, diabetes, cramps, diarrhea, stomach diseases, and hemorrhoids will all be pacified.

original: rims thams @379b cad rab tu zhi bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rims thams @379b cad rab tu zhi bar 'gyur te /
translated: All fevers will be pacified.

original: rims nyin bzhi pa dang / rlung las gyur pa dang / mkhris pa las gyur pa dang / bad kan las gyur pa dang / 'dus pa las gyur pa rnams rab tu zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rims nyin bzhi pa dang / rlung las gyur pa dang / mkhris pa las gyur pa dang / bad kan las gyur pa dang / 'dus pa las gyur pa rnams rab tu zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It will pacify fevers, whether of one, two, three, or four days’ duration, as well as those caused by wind, bile, phlegm, or their combination.

original: lus kyi nang gi nad thams cad la chu dron dang lhan cig sbyin no //
analyzed: lus kyi nang gi nad thams cad la chu dron dang lhan cig sbyin no //
translated: For all internal bodily illnesses, it should be used with warm water.

original: pha rol gyi nad thams cad dang / gnod pa thams cad la byugs pa tsam gyis yongs su grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pha rol gyi nad thams cad dang / gnod pa thams cad la byugs pa tsam gyis yongs su grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: For all external illnesses and harms, it will bring complete freedom merely through anointment.

original: thams cad du dgos pa thams cad la sbyar ba tsam gyis thams cad 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: thams cad du dgos pa thams cad la sbyar ba tsam gyis thams cad 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: For all purposes, it will accomplish everything merely through application.

original: the tshom mi bya'o //
analyzed: the tshom mi bya'o //
translated: There is no doubt about this.

original: gser gyis g-yogs pa dpung pa la btags na /
analyzed: gser gyis g-yogs pa dpung pa la btags na /
translated: If one ties it to one’s shoulder, covered in gold,

original: thams cad du thogs pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: thams cad du thogs pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: one will become unobstructed in all respects.

original: stobs dang / brtson 'grus dang / pha rol gnon pa phyag na rdo rje dang / padma 'chang dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stobs dang / brtson 'grus dang / pha rol gnon pa phyag na rdo rje dang / padma 'chang dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One will have the power, diligence, and supernormal powers of Vajrapāṇi and Padmanartṛīśvara.

original: dgos pa thams cad 'grub pa bla na med pa rnam pa gsum po 'di la sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: dgos pa thams cad 'grub pa bla na med pa rnam pa gsum po 'di la sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: One should apply these three unsurpassed methods for accomplishing all goals.

original: thig le dang / gdong pa bkru ba dang / lus bsku ba'o //
analyzed: thig le dang / gdong pa bkru ba dang / lus bsku ba'o //
translated: They are: the bindu, washing the face, and anointing the body.

analyzed: su gser gyi nor bu gzhag par bya'o //

original: kho ra khor yug tu padma bris la /
analyzed: kho ra khor yug tu padma bris la /

translated: In the center of the lotus, one should place a silver lotus, and place four full vases and four bali vases,

analyzed: me tog dgram par bya; tshon rnam pa sna tshogs kyi bri bar bya /

analyzed: 'phan gdugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyis brkyen  par bya /

analyzed: mar gyi mar me sum cu rtsa gnyis bltam par bya /

analyzed: 'bras bu dang me tog phreng sna tshogs gzhag par bya /

original: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug mngon du phyogs par bzhag ste rig sngags 'chang gtsang mas gos gtsang ma bgos la nyin mtshan gcig smyung ba byas la tshes bco lnga nas nyi shu dgu dang gnam stong gi bar dus mtshams gsum du mchod par bya zhing /

translated: The noble Avalokiteśvara should be placed facing toward oneself. The vidyādhara should be clean and wear clean clothes. He should fast for one day and one night. From the fifteenth to the twenty-ninth or thirtieth, he should make offerings three times a day.

original: padma za ma tog de dang / 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la yang mchod pa byas la dkyil 'khor gyi shar phyogs su mngon du phyogs te 'dug la bzlas brjod stong rtsa brgyad bya /

translated: Having made offerings to the lotus casket and to the noble Avalokiteśvara, he should sit facing east in the maṇḍala and recite the mantra eight thousand times.

original: khro bo'i rgyal po stong rtsa brgyad bzlas te yungs kar dang / chus dbang bskur bar bya /🔽don yod pa'i zhags @381a *//

original: pa'i phyag rgya stong rtsa brgyad bya /
analyzed: pa'i phyag rgya stong rtsa brgyad bya /

original: de bzhin du khro bo'i rgyal po'i phyag rgya bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du khro bo'i rgyal po'i phyag rgya bya'o //

original: mi smra bar dgos pa thams cad byas na /
analyzed: mi smra bar dgos pa thams cad byas na /

translated: then afterward, on the fifteenth day, at the time of the full moon, the king of jewels together with the lotus will blaze up as one, and a voice will emerge from the face of Ārya Avalokiteśvara. The knowledge-mantra reciter will be delighted.

original: nam mkha'i dkyil nas legs so zhes bya ba'i sgra 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: nam mkha'i dkyil nas legs so zhes bya ba'i sgra 'byung bar 'gyur /

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku chen po mthong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku chen po mthong bar 'gyur //

analyzed: de nas rig sngags 'chang gis padma 'bar ba de lag pa g-yas pas blang bar bya ste /

analyzed: blangs pa tsam gyi mod la nam mkha' la 'gro bar 'gyur zhing /

analyzed: rig sngags 'chang ba thams cad kyi 'khor los bsgyur bar 'gyur /

analyzed: 'khor lo'i rgyal po gser gyi mdog can blta na sdug pa chen po mdun na gnas par 'gyur /
translated: The great golden-hued Cakravartin, beautiful to behold, will stand before one.

analyzed: sdang ba dang / phyir rgol ba dang / mi mdza' ba thams cad zlog par byed /

analyzed: 'khor bye ba stong phrag bcu gnyis dang ldan pa'i rig sngags 'chang gi rgyal por 'gyur /

analyzed: don yod pa'i dri ma med pa 'bar ba'i @381b rtse mo rnam par lta ba zhes bya ba'i don yod pa'i zhags pa 'thob par 'gyur /

analyzed: phyogs bcu kun gyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rnam par 'phrul pa mthong bar 'gyur /
translated: They will see the emanations of the buddha realms of the tathāgatas in all the ten directions.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad kyis dbugs 'byin par 'gyur /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad kyis dbugs 'byin par 'gyur /

original: nor bu chen po yongs su dag pa rdo rje la rnam par lta ba'i 'od kyi lus rnam par dag pa thob par 'gyur /
analyzed: nor bu chen po yongs su dag pa rdo rje la rnam par lta ba'i 'od kyi lus rnam par dag pa thob par 'gyur /
translated: They will attain the pure body of light that is the great, pure jewel that looks at the vajra.

analyzed: mgo bo'i spyi bor btags na nor bu chen po'i rdzu 'phrul gyis nub phyogs su song nas bde ba can gyi rab tu dbye ba gzhal med khang dang bcas /

original: 'khor dang bcas /
analyzed: 'khor dang bcas /
translated: its retinue,🔽and its tathāgata.

analyzed: legs par brgyan pa'i dkyil 'khor dang / byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs dang bcas pa mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He will see the maṇḍala of the Tathāgata, well adorned, together with the assembly of bodhisattvas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de dag las chos snang ba'i sgo'i chos bshad pa chen po thob par 'gyur /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de dag las chos snang ba'i sgo'i chos bshad pa chen po thob par 'gyur /

original: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi gzugs dang / rgyan dang / gzhal med khang ston par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi gzugs dang / rgyan dang / gzhal med khang ston par 'gyur /
translated: He will see the form, ornaments, and celestial palace of the noble Avalokiteśvara.

original: mgul du btags na /
analyzed: mgul du btags na /
translated: If he ties it around his neck,

original: phug gi gnas thams cad du 'jug par 'gyur /
analyzed: phug gi gnas thams cad du 'jug par 'gyur /

original: thams cad du rgyal ba'i rje dpon dang / 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal por 'gyur /🔽phug stong @382a *//
analyzed: thams cad du rgyal ba'i rje dpon dang / 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal por 'gyur / phug stong @382a *//
translated: Everywhere he will be a victorious lord and a universal monarch.

original: phrag drug cu rtsa bzhi'i sgo 'bye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: phrag drug cu rtsa bzhi'i sgo 'bye bar 'gyur /
translated: The doors of sixty-four thousand caves will open.

original: dpung pa g-yas pa la btags na /
analyzed: dpung pa g-yas pa la btags na /
translated: If he ties it to his right arm,

original: mi snang bar 'gyur zhing lus mi snang ba gangg'a'i klung bye ba stong phrag brgya snyed kyi lus mi snang ba rnams kyi mchog rje dpon dang rgyal por 'gyur ro //

original: dpung pa g-yon pa la btags na /
analyzed: dpung pa g-yon pa la btags na /
translated: If it is tied to the left shoulder,

analyzed: gnod sbyin dang / srin po dang / 'byung po la sogs pa thams cad mi snang bar byas par 'gyur /
translated: all yakṣas, rākṣasas, bhūtas, and so forth will be rendered invisible.

analyzed: thams cad kyi gnas kyi gzhal med khang sgo bye zhing 'dug par 'gyur ro //
translated: The doors of the palaces of all the abodes will be opened.

original: rked pa la btags na /
analyzed: rked pa la btags na /
translated: If it is tied to the waist,

original: gter thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gter thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: all treasures will appear.

original: pus mo g-yas pa dang / brla g-yas pa la btags na /
analyzed: pus mo g-yas pa dang / brla g-yas pa la btags na /
translated: If it is tied to the right knee and right thigh,

original: nags kyi phug gi gzhal med khang gi gnas thams cad kyi sgo phye zhing /
analyzed: nags kyi phug gi gzhal med khang gi gnas thams cad kyi sgo phye zhing /
translated: the doors of all the palaces of the abodes in the forest will be opened.

analyzed: sman gyi dngos po thams cad rang gi gzugs kyis mdun na gnas par 'gyur zhing thams cad dbang du 'gyur ro //

original: rkang pa'i rje ngar la btags na /
analyzed: rkang pa'i rje ngar la btags na /
translated: If it is tied to the calf of the leg,

translated: In a single day and night, by the power of the great wind, he will travel to the worlds of the great trichiliocosm and return again, and no one will be able to harm him.

original: thams cad @382b du dgos pa sgrub pa thams cad grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad @382b du dgos pa sgrub pa thams cad grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will accomplish all his goals.

original: rkang mthil la btags na /
analyzed: rkang mthil la btags na /
translated: If one ties it to the soles of one’s feet,

original: sa'i 'og gi dngos grub chen po thob par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: sa'i 'og gi dngos grub chen po thob par 'gyur zhing /
translated: one will obtain the great power of the underworld.

original: sa'i 'og phug gi sgo thams cad bye bar 'gyur te /

original: rin po che sna bdun gzhag par bya /
analyzed: rin po che sna bdun gzhag par bya /

translated: Then, the pure vidyādhara should put on clean clothes, and make the maṇḍala four cubits square and one cubit high, and smear it well with a mixture of cow dung and clay, making the four sides equal.

translated: In the center of the maṇḍala, one should place various incense and flowers, various ointments, various offering bowls, beautiful full vases, and various types of incense powders.

analyzed: me tog rnam pa sna tshogs dang / me tog phreng ci 'byor pa kun tu gzhag par bya /

original: mar gyi mar me bzang po bcu drug bltam par bya /

analyzed: ro rnam pa sna tshogs dang dkar gsum ci 'byor pa gzhag par bya /

analyzed: me tog sna tshogs dgram par bya /

analyzed: me tog phreng ba bzang po kun tu gzhag par bya /

analyzed: bdug spos kyi snod dang bum pa gang ba kun tu gzhag par bya /

analyzed: ro sna tshogs kyi gtor ma dkar po rnam pa mang po gzhag par bya /

analyzed: mar gyi mar me gang ba drug cu rtsa gnyis dbul bar bya /
translated: Sixty-two full butter lamps should be offered.

original: 'bras yos dang / yungs kar dgram par bya /
analyzed: 'bras yos dang / yungs kar dgram par bya /

analyzed: chang @384b dang / sha dang / beg tsong dang / ke'u dang / 'bags pa dang / kha zas ngan pa dang / btung ba dan pa spang bar bya /

original: 'gom nyes spang bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'gom nyes spang bar bya ste /

analyzed: gtsang mas gos gtsang ma bgos la zla ba nya la bsgrub par bya'o //

analyzed: gu gul gyi bdug pa dang / mar dang / yungs kar gyi bdug pas bdug par bya'o //

analyzed: tsandan dang / aa ga ru dang / du ru ka dang / kun tu ru'i bdug pa 'di ni / yang dag par bstan to //

analyzed: bum pa sgrub pa 'di ni /

original: mchog ste / zha lnga smyung ba byas nas gsang sngags bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: mchog ste / zha lnga smyung ba byas nas gsang sngags bsgrub par bya ste /

analyzed: dus mtshams gsum du bum pa dang sangs rgyas la mchod pa bya'o //

analyzed: chu dang yungs kar gyis dbang bskur la don yod pa'i zhags pa'i snying po stong phrag bcu bzla'o //

original: de'i 'og tu tshes bco lnga nya'i thun tha ma'i nang par dbyig gi bum pa cher @385a *//
analyzed: de'i 'og tu tshes bco lnga nya'i thun tha ma'i nang par dbyig gi bum pa cher @385a *//

analyzed: legs so zhes bya ba'i sgra chen po yang grag par 'gyur te /

analyzed: bum pa chen po de yang 'bar zhing 'od zer kha dog sna tshogs 'byung bar 'gyur /

analyzed: dri ma med cing yongs su dag la dri ma dang bral bar 'gyur /

analyzed: mdog yongs su dag cing me tog padma dang / ku mu da ltar dkar zhing 'jam par 'gyur /

analyzed: bum pa de'i sku gzugs rnams rang rang gi lus las 'od zer 'byung bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de nas rig sngags 'chang gis 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la mchod pa rgya chen po bya /

original: rig sngags 'chang /
analyzed: rig sngags 'chang /
translated: Knowledge-mantra holder,
